publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-356 Fergus Ewing: The Millennium Dome—That the Parliament believes that the money spent on building the Millennium Dome has been wasted and should instead have been spent on providing for all United Kingdom pensioners a Millennium bonus of around £100.
S1M-356 The Millennium Dome (lodged on 3 December 1999) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-356 The Millennium Dome (lodged on 3 December 1999) Alasdair Morgan*, Christine Grahame*
S1M-356 The Millennium Dome (lodged on 3 December 1999) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*

S1M-356 Fergus Ewing: The Millennium Dome—That the Parliament believes that the money spent on building the Millennium Dome has been wasted and should instead have been spent on providing for all United Kingdom pensioners a Millennium bonus of around £100. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Alasdair Morgan, Christine Grahame, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Duncan Hamilton
S1M-356 The Millennium Dome (lodged on 3 December 1999) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Shona Robison*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-356 The Millennium Dome (lodged on 3 December 1999) Michael Matheson*
S1M-356 The Millennium Dome (lodged on 3 December 1999) Alex Neil*
S1M-356 The Millennium Dome (lodged on 3 December 1999) Richard Lochhead*

S1M-356 Fergus Ewing: The Millennium Dome—That the Parliament believes that the money spent on building the Millennium Dome has been wasted and should instead have been spent on providing for all United Kingdom pensioners a Millennium bonus of around £100. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Alasdair Morgan, Christine Grahame, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Shona Robison, Andrew Wilson, Michael Matheson, Alex Neil, Richard Lochhead

S1M-356 Fergus Ewing: The Millennium Dome—That the Parliament believes that the money spent on building the Millennium Dome has been wasted and should instead have been spent on providing for all United Kingdom pensioners a Millennium bonus of around £100.
